root.text: INTERNET OF THINGS (IOT) FOR MECHANICAL APPLICATIONS

The workshop focuses on the basic conceptual idea behind the characteristics, challenges and network configurations in IOT along with Data Collection, Data Processing and Data Analytics followed by Cloud Computing and Big Data. It also focuses on the MQTT using embedded systems. And the final part of the workshop will be the hands-on training with embedded systems, which will provide participants a deep practical knowledge about IOT.
NOTE: Participants should bring separate laptop, android mobiles for hotspot requirement.

text: 8:55 AM - Students must assemble at K-Block Seminar Hall.
9:00 AM – 10:30 AM - A detailed introduction to the basic concepts of IOT.
10:45 AM – 12:15 PM - A brief description about the Data Collection.
01:15 PM – 02:15 PM - An ideology about the MQTT and the Data Processing management followed by the Data Analytics Techniques.
02:30 PM – 4:00 PM - An interactive hands-on training with IOT Kits.
**The above mentioned schedule can be changed based on availability of time**
In case of on spot registration (subjected to availability), the students are requested to bring the exact sum of the mentioned amount for general registration along with the respective workshop fee.
Participants are requested to carry the hard copy of the workshop confirmation receipt.
Participants must have a valid ID card of their respective educational institutions.

root.text: Under any circumstances, the fee will not be refunded.
Fee is exclusive of food and accommodation
In addition to the workshop fee there will be a mandatory KRIYA registration fee of,
